creator: jhart@bates.edu

text:
This is probably not an access control bug, but rather a problem with the XSLT
processor. In your install log I don't see a note about the endorsed libraries -
did you copy them?
creator: andreas@apache.org
gregor@apache.org
text:
andreas,

what do you make of

Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException at
org.apache.lenya.cms.cocoon.transformation.UsecaseMenuTransformer.setup(UsecaseMenuTransformer.java:155)

line 155 is

selector =
(ComponentSelector) manager.lookup(AccessControllerResolver.ROLE + "Selector");

You're right, I didn't read careful enough.
The ClassCastException smells very much like Cocoon 2.1.3 ...
creator: andreas@apache.org

text:
If the problem persists, could you please provide further information about your
configuration?
creator: andreas@apache.org
jhart@bates.edu
text:
Which configuration information do you want? 

The info for Java, Tomcat, etc. is on the web page:
http://a4567.bates.edu/wiki/LenyaInstallLog

Here's the Linux and Apache info

[jhart@leeds jhart]$ cat /etc/issue
Red Hat Linux release 8.0 (Psyche)
Kernel \r on an \m
[jhart@leeds jhart]$ uname -a
Linux leeds.bates.edu 2.4.20-20.8 #1 Mon Aug 18 14:59:07 EDT 2003 i686 i686 i386
GNU/Linux
[jhart@leeds jhart]$ httpd -V
Server version: Apache/1.3.27 (Unix)
Server built:   Jan 20 2004 22:22:48
Server's Module Magic Number: 19990320:13
Server compiled with....

[jhart@leeds jhart]$ httpd -l
Compiled-in modules:
  http_core.c

suexec: disabled; invalid wrapper /usr/local/apache/bin/suexec

I see you downloaded
http://apache.mirrors.pair.com/cocoon/cocoon-latest-src.tar.gz

Which one is it? You have to use 2.1.2.
creator: andreas@apache.org
